Thus, the missing code in the TODO is simply checking whether the flag is set to 1. 

The correct code is thus:

#include <stdio.h>
int n, a;
int d[270000];
int flag, c;
int f(int st, int en) {
    if(st == en) return d[st];
    int m = (st + en)/2;
    int q = f(st, m);
    int w = f(m+1, en);
    if(abs(q-w) !=1) flag=1;
    return fmax(q, w)/2;
}
int main() {
    scanf("%d", &n);
    while(n--) {
        c=flag=0;
        scanf("%d", &a);
        for(int i=1; i<=a; i++)
            scanf("%d", d+i);
        f(1, a);
        if(flag) puts("-1");
        else printf("%d\n", c);
    }
}
